item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Because the brief, unsigned order came in response to an emergency petition, making it part of the court’s so-called shadow docket, where decisions get made quickly and without the benefit of oral arguments. But with the case all but guaranteed to end up back at the high court for a final say eventually, it does not tell us much about what the justices will ultimately decide when it gets there. And it’s going to rage: The matter reached the Supreme Court after a federal judge in Texas yanked the FDA’s approval of the drug. —AR What comes next? Why not? The government quickly appealed to the conservative-leaning US Court of Appeals for the 5th Circuit, which rejected parts of the judge’s decision but still imposed restrictions on the medicine’s availability. item.title: Is India rising to the top?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. ) working-age people in India. Zoom out: The UN says that India’s population could start declining in 2047. It’s due to surpass China as the most populous country on the planet this year, according to a UN report released this week. The India “buy” caseIndia has a lot going for it, including a massive labor force. India has already eclipsed its former colonizer, the United Kingdom, as the world’s fifth-largest economy, and it’s projected to nick Germany’s No. 4 spot by 2025, according to the Wall Street Journal. What’s holding India back? —SK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! There are 900 million(! But India also has plenty of homegrown success stories. India’s domination of the global economy is far from guaranteed. India better put on some shades or risk being blinded by the spotlight. And word on the pundit street is that it’s poised to get bigger in another way—by rivaling China and the US as a major economic superpower. It’s paying off: Companies looking to diversify their supply chains away from China have embraced India as an alternative manufacturing hub. And that number is increasing—unlike in most major economies, where an aging population is sapping economic growth. Let’s explore why India’s future looks bright, and some of the obstacles on its path to international economic stardom. Apple recently began assembling its new iPhone in the country, and Volvo signaled it might start building EVs there. Nobel Prize-winning economist Abhijit Banerjee thinks India should look inward before it projects its economic ambitions abroad.

The judge presiding over the case had already ruled that Fox News’s statements about Dominion’s role in the 2020 election were false. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeRight before starting its hugely anticipated libel trial, Fox News told Dominion Voting Systems, “How about we pay you $787.5 million and we not do this.” They say that in pushing former President Trump’s false “rigged election” narrative, Fox News helped foment the distrust of elections that led to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol—and this settlement doesn’t hold the network accountable. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Last month, a NY judge allowed the case to proceed. For Dominion…well, we’ll just let the $787.5 million do the talking, considering the company generates less than $100 million per year in sales, per Axios’s Dan Primack.

item.title: Fox News v. Dominion trial delayed over reported settlement talks
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Due to the precedent set in a 1964 Supreme Court case, Dominion has to demonstrate that Fox News acted with “actual malice” when reporting on it; in other words, that it recklessly disregarded the truth in its statements about Dominion. However, court documents have revealed that Fox News hosts privately admitted they did not believe the fraud claims they were making on air. Looking ahead…the judge presiding over this case has already ruled that it was “CRYSTAL clear” that Fox News’s statements about Dominion’s role in the 2020 election were false. What the case is aboutDominion Voting Systems, which makes electronic voting machines, has sued Fox News for defamation, accusing the network of knowingly pushing baseless claims about the company after the 2020 presidential election—including that it rigged vote counts to tilt the election in Joe Biden’s favor. The showdown between Fox News and Dominion was supposed to begin this morning, but last night the Delaware Superior Court delayed the start until tomorrow without providing a reason. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Fox News lawyers say the network is fully covered by its First Amendment rights—it was simply commenting on the election fraud claims made by former President Trump, which were newsworthy because he was the president of the US. While that’s not an insignificant amount of money, this case is being called the “Super Bowl” of libel cases for nonfinancial reasons: It could have lasting consequences for Fox News as well as the media industry’s First Amendment rights.

item.title: SpaceX attempts first orbital flight of Starship
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIn remote Texas this morning, SpaceX will attempt the first orbital launch of its towering Starship system, the reusable space vehicle CEO Elon Musk says will be the key that unlocks trips to the moon and Mars and eventually turns humanity into a “multi-planet species.” Previous Starship test runs have ended in fiery explosions, and Musk has put the odds of Starship getting to orbit this morning at 50%. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Everything about this launch pushes the limits of conventional space flight:Starship is made of stainless steel, which the space industry has typically shunned for its weight. Musk has acknowledged this flight might not go as planned. That could allow it to refuel on Mars, since the planet’s atmosphere contains trace amounts of the gas. Today at 8am ET, a two-and-a-half-hour launch window will open for Starship and the Super Heavy booster it’s mounted on.
